task.title: SDK improvements: WebSocket transport, RPC, Electron guide, spawn readiness

events.content: Transport abstraction layer for browser/Node.js compatibility: Transport abstraction layer for browser/Node.js compatibility

raw.question: Transport abstraction layer for browser/Node.js compatibility
raw.chosen: Transport abstraction layer for browser/Node.js compatibility
raw.reasoning: Created Transport interface with SocketTransport (Unix sockets) and WebSocketTransport implementations. This allows the SDK to work in both Node.js (Unix sockets) and browser (WebSocket) environments without code changes.

events.content: Correlation ID pattern for RPC: Correlation ID pattern for RPC

raw.question: Correlation ID pattern for RPC
raw.reasoning: Used correlation ID in message data field to track request/response pairs. The request() method generates a unique ID, stores a pending promise, and the respond() method echoes the ID back. This is simpler than adding new protocol message types.

events.content: AGENT_READY broadcast for spawn readiness: AGENT_READY broadcast for spawn readiness

raw.question: AGENT_READY broadcast for spawn readiness
raw.reasoning: Added new AGENT_READY protocol message type that daemon broadcasts when an agent completes HELLO/WELCOME handshake. This is cleaner than polling or callbacks, and allows any connected client to know when agents become ready.

events.content: contextBridge pattern for Electron IPC: contextBridge pattern for Electron IPC

raw.question: contextBridge pattern for Electron IPC
raw.reasoning: Documented the secure contextBridge pattern with preload scripts, keeping the relay client in the main process and exposing only safe IPC methods to the renderer. Includes React hook example for easy integration.

retrospective.summary: Implemented 4 SDK improvements: WebSocket/browser transport with abstraction layer, native RPC pattern with correlation IDs, comprehensive Electron integration guide, and spawn readiness detection with AGENT_READY protocol. All changes committed to feature/sdk-improvements branch.
